firstLevel.name: Unarmored Defense
firstLevel.description: While you are not wearing any armor, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Constitution modifier. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

firstLevel.name: Rage
firstLevel.description: In battle, you fight with primal ferocity. On your turn, you can enter a rage as a bonus action. (ET AL)

secondLevel.name: Reckless Attack
secondLevel.description: Starting at second level, you can throw aside all concern for defense and attack with fierce desperation. When you make your first attack on your turn, you can decide to attack recklessly. Doing so gives you advantage on melee weapon attack rolls using Strength during this turn, but attack rolls against you have advantage against you until next turn.

secondLevel.name: Danger Sense
secondLevel.description: At second level, you gain an uncanny sense of when things nearby aren't as they should be, giving you an edge when you dodge away from danger. You have advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects you can see, such as traps and spells. To gain this benefit, you can't be blinded, deafened, or incapacitated.

thirdLevel.name: Primal Path (Archetype Choice)
thirdLevel.description: At third level, you choose a path that shapes the nature of your rage. Choose the Path of the Berserker or the Path of the Totem Warrior, both detailed below. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th levels.

fourthLevel.name: Ability Score Improvement
fourthLevel.description: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

fifthLevel.name: Extra Attack
fifthLevel.description: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

fifthLevel.name: Fast Movement
fifthLevel.description: Starting at 5th level, your speed increases by 10 while you are not wearing heavy armor.

seventhLevel.name: Feral Instinct
seventhLevel.description: By 7th level, your insticts are so honed that you have advantage on initiative rolls. Additionally, if you are surprised at the beginning of combat and aren't incapactitated, you can act normally on your first turn, but only if you enter your rage before doing anything else on that turn.

ninethLevel.name: Brutal Critical
ninethLevel.description: Beginning at 9th level, you can roll one additional weapon damage die when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with a melee attack. This increases to two additional dice at 13th level and three additional dice at 17th level.

eleventhLevel.name: Relentless Rage
eleventhLevel.description: Starting at 11th level, your rage can keep you fighting despite grievous wounds. If you drop below 0 hit points while you are raging and don't die outright, you can make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. If you succeed, you drop to 1 hit point instead. Each time you use this feature after the first, the DC increases by 5. When you finish a short or long rest, the DC resets to 10.

fifteenthLevel.name: Persistent Rage
fifteenthLevel.description: Beginning at 15th level, your rage becomes so fierce that it ends early only if you fall unconscious or if you choose to end it.

eighteenthLevel.name: Indomitable Might
eighteenthLevel.description: Beginning at 18th level, if your total for a Strength check is less than your Strength score, you can use that score in place of the total.

twentiethLevel.name: Primal Champion
twentiethLevel.description: At 20th level, you embody the power of the wilds. Your Strength and Constitution scores increase by 4. Your maximum for those scores is now 24.

firstLevel.name: Bardic Inspiration
firstLevel.description: You can inspire others through stirring words or music. To do so, you use a bonus action on your turn to choose one creature other than yourself within 60 feet of you who can hear you. That creature gains a Bardic Inspiration die, a d6. (ET AL)

secondLevel.name: Jack of All Trades
secondLevel.description: Starting at 2nd level, you can add half your proficiency bonus, rounded down, to any ability check you make that doesn't already include your proficiency bonus.

secondLevel.name: Song of Rest
secondLevel.description: Beginning at 2nd level, you can use soothing music or oration to help revitalize your wounded allies during a short rest. If you or any friendly creatures who can hear your performance regain hit points at the end of the short rest by spending one or more Hit Dice, each of those creatures regains an extra 1d6 hit points. The extra hit points increase when you reach certain levels in this class: to 1d8 at 9th level, to 1d10 at 13th level, and to 1d12 at 17th level.

thirdLevel.name: Bard College (Archetype Choice)
thirdLevel.description: At third level, you delve into the advanced techniques of the bard college of your choice: the College of Lore or the College of Valor, both detailed below. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th and 14th level.

fourthLevel.name: Ability Score Improvement
fourthLevel.description: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

fifthLevel.name: Font of Inspiration
fifthLevel.description: Beginning when you reach 5th level, you regain all of your expended uses of Bardic Inspiration when you finish a short or long rest.

sixthLevel.name: Countercharm
sixthLevel.description: At 6th level, you gain the ability to use musical notes or words of power to disrupt mind-influencing effects. As an action, you can start a performance that lasts until the end of the next turn. During this time, you and any friendly creatures within 30 feet of you have advantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed. A creature must be able to hear you to gain this benefit. The performance ends early if you are incapacitated or silenced or if you voluntarily end it (no action required).

tenthLevel.name: Magical Secrets
tenthLevel.description: By 10th level, you have plundered magical knowledge from a wide spectrum of disciplines. Choose two spells from any class, including this one. A spell you choose must be of a level you can cast, as shown on the Bard table, or a cantrip. The chosen spells are considered bard spells for you and are included in the number in the Spells Known column of the Bard table. You learn two additional spells from any class at 14th level and again at 18th level.

twentiethLevel.name: Superior Inspiration
twentiethLevel.description: At 20th level, when you roll initative and have no uses of Bardic Inspiration left, you regain one use.
